org.mongodb.session

Interface AsyncServerSelectingSession

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AsyncClusterSession

    public interface AsyncServerSelectingSession
    A provider of asynchronous connections to servers based on a server selector.
    Since:
    3.0

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        <T> MongoFuture<T> execute(AsyncServerSelectingOperation<T> operation)
        Executes the given operation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type of the operation
        Parameters:
        operation - the operation to execute
        Returns:
        a future representing the result of executing the operation

      • getBoundSession

        <T> MongoFuture<AsyncSession> getBoundSession(AsyncServerSelectingOperation<T> operation,
                                            SessionBindingType sessionBindingType)
        Gets a new session that is bound to a single server or a single connection, based on the given binding type. In the former case, the new session will cache the server instance it's bound to and reuse it for subsequent requests for a connection. In the latter case, the new session will cache the connection it's bound to and reuse it for subsequent requests for a connection.

        Care should be taken to not close this session until after any bound sessions that came from it are also closed.

        Parameters:
        operation - the operation whose server selector is used to bind the session
        sessionBindingType - the binding type
        Returns:
        a future for the bound session

      • close

        void close()

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
